There's usually some reading material tossed about on the coffee table or piano and I've never been annoyed or bothered by other patrons or their dogs. Normally, I avoid skaggy bathrooms at all costs, but I gotta say that there's a charm about Uptown's oversized onesie---it's a bit of a reading room. Bring your own sharpie!
author: Stumbalina b.

description: Decent semi-dive bar...they have a pinball machine which is a huge plus in my book.  Bartenders seem on point, and drinks were supercheap.  I was a bit too sketched to sit on the couches, but overall a decent  place to stop for a drink and a round of pinball.
author: Jaimie M.

description: I think this is my favorite bar in the entire world. It just never ever changes. It's dank, dark, dismal, the couches in the corner are disgusting. I LOVE IT! If this place ever tries to attract marina douchebags like Dalva and Delirium, I will be very very angry.
author: Andrew L.

description: The bartender was very friendly; she does service with a smile better than that Wal-Mart happy face. Minus a half for not knowing what a brandy separator is, but then again, I didn't know either. I purchased a white russian instead, which didn't make me feel the least bit drunk until I stood up. The lighting is perfectly dark, so that anything that may be really dirty isn't noticeable, but you can still actually see the person you are sitting across from. Minus another half for the very conspicuous bars on the windows, though I guess it wouldn't be a dive without them.
author: Midori G.

description: Fantastic dive bar with $4.50 Hendricks and Tonics and awesome bartenders.  The perfect place to start or end an evening (or just spend the evening there).
author: MJ C.

description: My favorite bar to get away from it all. I usually only know maybe one person here and go for Happy Hour on Thurs with the lovely Shay. Good on a sunny day when you want to do some people watching while sipping a nice refreshing mojito or blueberry Stoli drink.  Plenty of other activities to be had in sundry seating arrangements, from the nice barstools, back area by the pool table or the cozy living room area. I have fond memories of hanging out with my arty farty friends here when they came to town. Or the old standby when we'd be on our way to one of the 17th Street warehouse punk nights, sigh.
author: Colleen B.

description: One of my favorite places although I don't get there often as I used to.  They know how to make a martini, and give you a shot back without being asked.  The staff, the owner, are as nice as it gets and they always show their appreciation to a good customer with a decent habit.  The neighborhood is more than a little iffy, but just increases the appeal for me.
author: Cheezy P.

description: Uptown is a disappointing dive with a scary ladies' toilet.  The bartender either didn't know how to fix the drink I requested, or she didn't have all the ingredients.  I will never ever ever visit this bar again.  Gross.  Can you believe a man brought me here?  Uptown is no place for a lady.
author: Camille K.

description: Best place to get loaded on a Tuesday and chat with some beautiful hipster boy and a hobo crack head
author: aynne v.

description: It's a mission dive, so you know pretty much exactly what you're getting into. Filthy. Pool table. Small and crowded. Unremarkable but enjoyable. Decent beer selection on tap.
author: Nick H.

description: Nostalgia follows me each time I go here b/c it's so much like bars back in Philly.  But then I remember why I left Philly, too.  The thing I like most about this bar is that you can actually have conversations here.  The drinks are well priced and it's three blocks away from my house.  Out.
author: Rhea S.

description: Excellent dive bar. Runner up to the Latin American on Sun, Mon, or Tues nights. It's got a great classic jukebox, a pooltable and couches to crouch in with your posse.  Best on a rainy winter night when you can cozy up to your friends in a booth and look out at the wet weather outside on 'charming' ;-) capp street. Sometimes it's almost empty and you get the whole place to yourselves! (not wed-sat!)
author: Maïa Cybelle C.

description: The quintessential dive bar, The Uptown always comes off shady and usually pretty stanky. The jukebox, like the bar is an eclectic mix so whatever you're into you should be able to find something you dig. You'll also find pool, pinball and I seem to have a hazy memory of a sit down Mrs. Pac Man. The best part about this place is that there is no posturing or scenester bullshit, just real folks who like to get their drink on. Definitely not the kind of place you will find Blondie's overflow. (NOTA) The Bar is in the center of the space so it won't take a half hour to get a drink. If you're there by 11:30 or so you can probably catch the Tamale Lady before she heads to Zeitgeist!
author: Mingus R.

description: Yes, the Uptown is one of the seeeeeediest bars around. Just round the corner from gross and grosser. But somehow, it has grown on me and I love going there! Especially on monday evenings, when it is HOT and a girl neeeeeds a cold DRINK! Brion can whip up a cool tall glass of fresh strawberry lemonade vodka, and don't tell, but even the boys were drinking these fruity ones! Nuff said!
author: Ingrid K.

description: Like a pair of old comfortable shoes the uptown awaits your nightcap needs. Bartenders are really laid back and friendly and if it's not too crowded it's a great place to bring friends, play pool, sit in a booth, and listen to a great jukebox. I like this place on a dark and rainy day and they will even make a great hot toddy. Minus one star for some of the younger generation messengers(not all, just the coked up rude ones). SF's version of backwoods mountain dew drinking "extreme" douchebags (like the ones in Harold and Kumar go to White Castle). Only the mountain dew is cocaine, and the trucks are fixies.
author: Julian M.

description: One of the better bars in the neighborhood. Granted, most of the bars in the mission are complete crap weekend nights...but, somehow the uptown is a bit more bearable. A friend of mine once passed out on one of the couches and woke up with a pseudo-homeless, smelly guy cuddled up to him. Always something entertaining going on at the Uptown.
author: Steven C.

description: 50 cent pool, Neil Young on the juke, pin ball and a piano. Racer five is $3.75 a pint and the crowd is always nice. Couches and booths. My oh my this bar is just fantastic. The only thing I would have said that they were missing: dice and a deck of cards but no matter, I purchased some for this fine establishment last night so make sure to ask for them when you go in if you're like me and enjoy liar's dice with your friends. Jennifer the bar keep is as nice as they come, John takes some warming up to. You can usually find me at the piano.
author: eric m.

description: Excellent when you're rolling 5 deep with idiot boyfriends and can brave the maelstrom of funky lewdness when disembarking the 22 at 16th St. BART. Comfy couches and eclectic selection of inexpensive libations. Dim lighting in the main room is a bonus. The jukebox is well rounded, though an update would be nice.  I've spotted cuties here as well.
author: Coco K.

description: At first, I thought this place was condemned or otherwise unusable since the entrance looks disreputable and caged off. Then I clonked myself on the head and remembered I totally love all things disreputable and, er, caged. Not always. Anyway, for a refreshing shift from the attitude and asinine tastes of other, less seedy MIssion watering holes, come here. It gets pretty packed on the weekends, but on less tumultuous nights, some of the greatest dramas and comedies of the last year have taken place here.
author: Kimberly V.

description: Best dive it can be without being creepy so close to Crapp Street. The bartenders are friendly, the people aren't pretentious. What more can you ask for?
author: Erin O.

description:
dear uptown,

while i do like the fact that your men are cute, your drinks are cheap and get me drunk quickly (i am all about economically efficient drinking), i do not appreciate the bitchy bartendress who ignored me for 15 minutes at an empty bar, cutting lemons and limes while i sat there and made eye contact multiple times without success.  when that didn't work, i tried the other bartendress, who flirted with a patron for 5  more minutes and then ran off into some back room.  apparently i didn't look cool enough to be served until my hipster friend mooni p. came and flagged her down.  in the meantime, i'm going to give you the benefit of the doubt and blame it on an eye-contact miscommunication.  next time, i'll make sure to wear some skinny jeans, jump on top of the bar and wave my money in your face.

yours truly,
kk
author: Katherine K.

description: like everyone's mentioned before... YES! it's quite the hipster hangout. bothers most people. me not so much. cheap beer and the chill environment is enough for me to want to go back. can get a bit crowded on the weekends but can be a real pleasure during the week. love the couches and the employees. when people say they wanna meet up at the uptown, i usually have a hard time saying no.
author: Andrew D.

description: I heart Uptown. Just a few blocks from my work, this is a perfect happy hr spot for my coworkers and I. It's casual, the bartenders are friendly and it's that local dive bar tucked in the mission where people just come to drink and hangout. This is not the place where you go to see and be seen but for an alcoholic like me who depends on happy hours to get through the work week....this is my little gem.
author: Richard K.

description:
i like the uptown in oakland better.

or at least, i used to. 

since the uptown in oakland is currently closed. 

sigh...
author: Irene S.

description: Seemed like a good crowd of people--but I'm really new to the city so I felt like it wasn't the type of place you go to and meet anyone new cause everyone seemed to have their little groups. Bartender was really nice and got to us right away. Dolly on the jukebox..yessss.
author: Krystha B.

description: don't let its capp st locale scare you off, this is a very cool nice clean establishment, with comfy couches and booths, great music selections and STIFF drinks. And i guess if you wanted a prostitute after your night of drinking you came to the right street huh?!
author: Lauren V.

description: Great spot for a drink in the Mission, if you feel like slumming it.  This bar does not try to be anything other then what it is...  a spot for booze hounds to hunt down a pint.
author: Tony A.

description: So cheap, so divey. When this place is busy, it's really great. When this place is not busy, it sucks. What does that mean: it's a dump that attracts a cool crowd.
author: Skyler C.

description: This is a great dive bar in a seedy part of the mission.  Uptown as plenty of places to sit and a relaxed atmosphere.  They have an excellent beer selection including Abita from the Big Easy, Anchor Porter, and Mirror Pond Pale Ale.  Also, the prices are really cheap - less than 4 bucks a pint.  Great spot to hang with friends.
author: Moe J.

description:
the knock may be the greatest thing in all of bar history. it means that you are nice enough, a decent tipper and you are in a sweet bar that knows how to do things the right way.

you order your 5-6 90th drink and as you go to pay the bartender knocks on the bar. free baby  free!!!!

every time i have gone to uptown this has happened( i think this says more of them than of my drinking maybe?)and i am cheap beer guy so its not like i was making them alot of money. add that to a place with a great jukebox pinball!  some super comfy couches, a nice long bar with an opening for the other side of the bar and a pool table well that is all a bar needs.
author: Chris G.

description: It can get pretty crowded here on the weekends, sure, but it's a hell of a lot better than squeezing your way between coked up skaters, taggers and SFSU slutbags at delirium. The jukebox here is awesome, the bartenders are the least pissed off of any bar I've ever been to in the mission, and the drinks are strong. Get yourself a bunderburg and jameson and you'll be made in the shade. The clientele is what one might expect from a bar on 17th and capp, though yuppie transplants do have tendency to show up expecting "Uptown" to mean "Overpriced and White". That is, if they don't get scared away by Snoop, the friendliest crackhead in town. He gave ME change! The only reason I'm docking these guys a star is because I'm there all the time, step outside for MULTIPLE cigarettes, and the bouncer asks for my ID every fucking time.
author: Willy M.

description: On friday and saturday nights, when the D(elirium) is packed with yuppies trying to slum it, this is where a percentage of the weekday Delirium crowd goes.  Good divey bar, lots of hipsters.  Never standing room packed, and they have a pool table.
author: Matt N.

description:
this bar is OKAY. only because it is really close to my apartment & there is a lord of the rings pinball machine. it has a really relaxing feel to it unless you go on a busy night. the big tables make it easy to sit with your friends & chat if you can actually get a table. the jukebox has a good selection of music but hearing it at this bar just makes me kind of sick. its not the only place in a 4 block radius that serves drafts for $4 & pbr/tecate for $2, though. the bartender has never been nice & the well drinks are too weak. 

ive never been desperate enough to go to this bar; id rather just go to kilowatt, delirium, or benders.
author: Annette s.

description: Stopped in recently to this refreshingly off the beaten path dive bar while waiting for a table at Maverick, which has no bar to wait in. After stepping over and around all the bikes parked outside, we found a dark (as dive bars should be), and fairly clean (as clean as dive bars can be) interior, with a down to earth vibe. They have booths, what looked like a sofa seating area, and a pool table on the other side of the bar.
author: N B.

description: Everytime I go to this place I am struck with a whiff of foul body odor...seriously....EVERYTIME.  Oh, and the first time I came to this place, I had to tell some nerd boys burning napkins to STFU!!!  They were probably not even old enough to be in a bar and consuming alcohol.  Other than that, this bar is okay.  I will go here again and suffer the aroma.  I'm a lush and this place is 10 times better than any bar in the Marina.
author: Christina S.

description: This used to be my local bar when I lived in the Mission. It was really cool and what I would solidly call I dive. This is where I learned how to play (and simultaneously forgot) pool. The drinks were fairly cheap, and have probably gone up in price. But overall, it is a fairly unpretentious bar when I used to go there.
author: Gina R.

description: Alright dive bar.  We came on a weeknight and it was somewhat empty.  So the alcohol came quick and we got seats at the bar.  I'm happy.
author: Naomi N.

description: I enjoy this bar.  I like the couches in the back and I would have given it five stars if I didn't hear the SAME songs over and over again on the jukebox.  The bartenders are great and generally pretty good people hang out here. Thursday nights are my fav.  Don't forget the bar is CASH only.
author: Jessica T.

description: The Uptown is always solid for a low-key atmosphere, a relatively cheap beer (under $4), and comfortable couches.  There's a pool table in back and a pretty decent jukebox.  My favorite parts, besides the comfy couches, are the bathrooms (complete with fecalface.com stickers) and the huge painting above the couch area.  The place has character and is definitely chill.
author: Jon A.

description: i really liked this bar!  it had a great energy, not too snobby or hipster!  cheap pbrs (2 dollas on a saturday?!!) and friendly folk.  we found some nice people right upon entering.  cute boys A+++ :)
author: Lindsey W.

description: This is hands down my favorite bar in this part of the city. I have made people walk here from BART when they say "Hey, you know a good bar in the Neighborhood"
author: Gabe L.

description: I just have never managed to get Uptown, despite going their with friends on several occasions.  It is a dive bar, but to me it seems more that it is more just falling apart.  Maybe it is just ending up there at the end of the night, but I find drinking there really depressing, sort of like one of the make Moe's look really soul crushing on the Simpson's episodes.  Not the sort of thing that makes me want to keep drinking, which really isn't helpful when I really want to keep drinking.
author: Alured P.

description: Two words. Beer Nuts.They have them packaged for fiddy centavos! (never eat a communal bowl of nuts or pretzels), unless you like germs, and i am not speaking about the band. This dive has a rad juke, pool table, and ample lounging space. The one drawback is the counter has that rounded edge corner that is tough to navigate if you're reading or whatnot, but you're at a bar, you're supposed to be drinking and socializing, not homework! The tenders of the bar are cool too, with little 'tude. It's in my neighborhood, and not too clique-y.
author: wayne s.

description: This is my favorite bar in San Francisco, make that my favorite bar in California. They loose one star for not having enough room around the pool table, when you're drunk and trying to excuse your self for jabbing people in the stomach with a pool cue it gets complicated. The Juke box is divine, the couches and the booths are comfy, though dingy and the staff has always been nothing less than holy. The drinks are very well made especially for a dive and they have a good selection of booze, including something with a whole rattle snake in it, no joke!
author: Amelia T.

description: Perfect as a dive bar. Mission hipsters? Check. Sketchy location? Check. Dirt cheap drinks? Check. After spending absurd amounts of money on drinks in Miami, anywhere that charges me $6 for a round definitely gets four stars. I'll be back.
author: Jason B.

description: Great dive bar, my only problem is they don't take cards (I hate carrying cash). Other than that, super mellow place...not a pickup-type place usually some pretty cool peepz. Many of the same people there every time I go in there. Decent but not spectacular beer selection, I find it can be a good jumping-off point.
author: Jeremy W.

description: A pretty good bar. It has pool, friendly bartenders, relatively inexpensive drinks, a number of good beers on draft and pinball.  If I ever get around to making a list of the 10 worst men's restrooms in San Francisco, this one is going on it. On the other hand, fastidious people probably wouldn't go in here anyway. Plus, I always clean my bathroom after every time I go here, so it does create good habits, which is unusual for bars.
author: Surly V.

description:
I live across the street from the Uptown and I could not have asked the divebargods for anything more in a neighborhood bar. Nicest bartenders, best jukebox, and fully functions as my living room when I need a place to watch the news with friends. Also, the Pink Drink has ruined me many a time, and is now the first clause in many of my favorite stories: "So this one time Christa made me a Pink Drink and theeeeen..."
Heart you Uptown.
author: Stephany A.

description: I showed up for the hour before last call and had a good time. It was one of the darkest bars ever. There might have been a big painting?
author: B C.

description: i enjoy the uptown when it is not too crowded. they have a great jukebox selection and a pool table that only costs 50 cents for a round. it's also nice to sit at a booth and chat with a circle of friends. the bartenders have always been friendly, the drinks tasty, and the company good.
author: Kayla K.

description: Man, fuck this bar! What a shithole. My worst all time bar experience happened just the other night at said uptown. Have you ever been in a bar that not only denied you water but whose bartender (I believe his name is John) leaned his arm smugly on the counter and said "Are you gonna get a beer with that?" My reply "Not quite yet but I am sure I will in a few." He responsed to me, smugly and like a dipshit, "How do I know your not gonna just drink it and leave?" Its water, guy, its free in San Francisco and in most places in our country. Yes we have a limited supply and we need to solve the worlds water problems but guess what? WE NEED IT TO LIVE! My girlfriend and I walked across half the city to get to this dive (which up until this point was a favorite bar of mine.) She asked me to get her a water and I tried my best. After the douche-bag bartenders third "you can't have water jerk" comment I told him to fuck off and walked back to our booth. Upon hearing this my girlfriend got up and asked him "Are you really not gonna give me a water?" He gave her a couple words and she pointed out that we were here with 20 or so people. Easily three quarters of the bars customers. "What if they all ordered water?" he said. Good point guy. You're an asshole. At that point I was pissed and started yelling about what a dick he was, fuck you for not giving us water, who made you god of the drunks, etc, etc....All he could do is cower into his corner and cry that "I don't like the way you are talking to me." Oh boo-hoo you fucking moron! Wow, ruined my night. I wanted to leave and almost had all 20 convinced to leave but they were expecting more friends. Who am I to ruin a poor girls party. So I played pool and had a some friends buy a few beers for me. I didn't want to give that jackass the satisfaction of getting me a drink. I have never been so pissed at a bartender or waiter in my entire life. So smug and moronic. Such an ass. Anyway and once again Zero Stars for the Uptown mainly for the jackass bartender, which is sad because other than that...it is a pretty nice dive.
author: tex w.

description: Had been coming here on the regular for a quick couple drinks either heading to or from some other place. Most times, the Uptown has nice, efficient bartenders and a generally good vibe. After last night, I will never go here again. The unfortunate denouement of our evening: friend orders our drinks at 1:40 AM, bartender announces last call at 1:45 AM. Chunky, usually benign, pseudo-intellectual doorman, decides that he can remove our full drinks from the table at 1:48AM, literally taking my friends whiskey and coke OUT OF HIS HANDS. Other friend wouldn't give his up, and doorman starts shaking with fury; shaking like Muhammed Ali with the DTs and then acts like he is going to punch him. Disgusting way to treat your patrons. His power-trippin (almost psychotic) ego can be measured by his beard. Gah.
author: Anon Y.

description: smells terrible but the bartender is one kick a** lady. my credit card didn't work after she made the drinks and she just replied, 'there's more to life than money kid' and let me be on my way.
author: Derek Alistair J.

description: cozy hipster bar right off mission street at 17th. cash-only bar, couches, pool table, music blaring, booths, lotsa straight people but some queers too...sort of like the crowd of latin american club but on the other side of mission street. a good place to take just about anyone wanting to go to a normal mission bar.
author: Marla W.

description: this was the bar i was waiting for. unsuspecting when i walked in, i instantly felt stoked to be there. you are lucky if you arrive in time to score the coveted couch spots. this is one of those rare bars that you can approach from all angles - instead of a mirror behind the bar there is a window framing the faces of those whose names are next up on the chalkboard for pool. extra love for there being a pinball machine and a jukebox too. all that plus $2 PBR and a friendly and urban-ly attractive crowd? yessss....
author: julia r.

description: sometimes this place is just too hip, and due to the fact that i, however, am not, i sometimes feel a little outa place.  that doesn't change the fact that the bartenders are rad, and the drinks are cheap.  go there.
author: Dingo P.

description: This place has the dive-bar attitude and decor but without the disgusting, unusable bathrooms. It typically has plenty of seating in the form of wooden booths and sofas. The pool room has just the one table and is a bit cramped, but the surface is in better shape than the felt on tables at most bars. What's more, there's rarely a line to play, and each game only costs 50 cents. The jukebox has a good selection of rockin' tunes (read: classic rock, punk, Johnny Cash and the like), and the clincher is that the drinks are cheap: $2 for a standard beer, $3 for a premium beer and $3 for a well drink. The crowd manages to keep its contingents of the too-cool-for-schoolers and the scenesters to a minimum, so it tends to be nice and chill.
author: Eugene P.

description: this is definately a hipster bar.  The drinks are cheap but on a friday night its prety darn crowded.
author: pauline e.
